videos.description:

videos.title: God's Story: Zacchaeus
videos.description:

When Zacchaeus realized that Jesus loved him even though he had messed up, he wanted to show that kind of love to others. You can find this story in Luke 19:1-9.

videos.title: Kids' Club Acoustic: Do Like You Do
videos.description:
So here's a cool story. About a year ago, a Kids' Club volunteer songwriter got back from a trip to South Africa where she had heard the local kids play a game called "Do Like You Do". After sharing that story with a larger group of Kids' Club songwriters, one wrote a song inspired by the story and, a few months later, on a different trip to South Africa, that song was used to help lead a Vacation Bible School in Cape Town. This fall, the same song will be made available on crossroadskidsclub.net for free. We love that story.
Kids' Club Acoustic is a series highlighting brand spankin' new songs and old favorites that feel new again. For more great content and songs, visit crossroadskidsclub.net.

videos.title: Mysteries of the Bible: Numbers
videos.description:
Ever wondered why some people in the Bible really like to mention certain numbers but maybe you never understood why?

Seven times seventy, God rested on the 7th day, seven oxen?

Sometimes in the Bible, numbers were more than numbers. Some times they were mysterious ways of saying something was important. 

Like the number seven. In Genesis 2:2 God creates a day of rest, the seventh day, and called it the Sabbath. Later on in the Bible, seven becomes an important number to the Israelites.  Kinda like saying “If it happens seven times, God must be trying to tell us something.”   

Forty show up when something is completed. Wandering for 40 years. Moses spends 40 days on Mount Sinai to receive the commandments. Jesus was tested for 40 days and 40 nights. God flooded the earth for 40 days.

In a similar way, twelve shows up as a complete group. There were 12 tribes of Israelites. Jesus chose 12 disciples to spread the good news. When jesus feeds the 5,000 with fish and bread the Disciples pick up 12 basketfuls of leftovers. 

And then there is 3; the number of the Trinity. Which is God, the Holy Spirit and Jesus. In Genesis, God made the Earth on the third day. Jesus rose from the grave on the third day. 

SO, sometimes a number is more than a number.

Think about that next time you open your Bible.

Check out more cool stuff at http://crossroadskidsclub.net/

videos.title: Mysteries of the Bible: God's Names
videos.description:
Ehyeh Asher Ehyeh, Abba, El-Shaddai, Adonai and Immanuel. Sound familiar? That’s because those are some of the names for God. “But wait, I thought there was only one name?”

In the Bible God tells us his name many times. He uses different names to describe something about his character. It’s important to know that God is pretttty big and that one name doesn’t fully explain who he is.

Like Abba. To Jesus, God was like a loving father. Tender, caring and personal. This was like calling God papa, something you would only call your own dad.

Ehyeh Asher Ehyeh. When Moses was commanded to free the Israelites from Egypt, he asked God “What is your name.” God said Ehyeh Asher Ehyeh, which means I will be who I will be, the one who was, the one who is and who forever will be, or I am so many things, you couldn’t wrap your mind around it.
 
El Shaddai. When Abraham met God, Abraham was in his 90s and God promised to provide Abraham with as many descendants as stars in the sky. God called himself El Shaddai then, which means almighty provider. 

Adonai. God knows what is best for us and expresses that in this name. It means Lord, master, like a parent that wants us to listen to him. There is one voice that you should listen to more than any other and that is God’s, Adonai’s.

And then there is Immanuel. This is a special one, it means God with us and is another name for Jesus. God became human not only to save us but live like us.

SO, God’s name means so much more than just a word; it shows his character, his identity and what he is like.

Check out more cool stuff at http://crossroadskidsclub.net/

videos.title: Mysteries of the Bible: Love
videos.description:
Ahavah, Raya, Dod and Agape. These are all different kinds of love, and in the Bible, love is used 526 times! The question is, does God love us with just ONE type of love? 

We only have one word to express love in English, and we use it A-LOT! But in the Bible, love is expressed in MANY different ways, and it means something a little different. To love someone was to sacrifice for someone, even if they didn’t do anything for you in return. Here's a few words in hebrew that explain this.

Ahavah. It means “I will give.” You love so much that you Can’t Stop giving, no matter what. This love is all about action. You love, so you act. This is the foundation of all other forms of love.

Raya is the love for your friend. Your best friend, who you can tell anything to and enjoy hanging around. There’s lots of laughter, joy and trust here.

Dod is the kind of physical love you show by holding someone’s hand or hugging them. Sometimes you even want to give them a kiss. 

Agape is the love between God and his family. The love that makes you feel like you belong with God. It’s unconditional love, that means no matter what, we are loved and a part of God’s family.

SO, God shows his love for us in many different ways. But it isn't just a feeling. It's an action. 

Check out more cool stuff at http://crossroadskidsclub.net/

videos.title: Mysteries of the Bible: Jesus
videos.description:
Did you know that Jesus was always in God’s story? Maybe you also thought there was a lot of talk about a “lamb of God” in the Old Testament. 

So, a prophecy is God’s way of telling us something that he wants us to know and, with Jesus, God knew he would send his son to save us. All the way back to the Old Testament. Here are a few places in the Bible that show this.

God tested Abraham by asking him to sacrifice his only son, who he loved, but then stops Abraham and provides him with a different sacrifice. God was setting up a prophecy for when He was going to sacrifice his son, Jesus, just like he asked Abraham to do.

King David wrote word for word how Jesus was going to be hated and hurt. In Mark 15:33, when Jesus was on the cross, he says the first line of Psalm 22 to help us connect these two things.

In Exodus Moses and all the Israelites were commanded to celebrate the Passover, sacrificing a clean and perfect lamb. In the New Testament, Jesus becomes the literal lamb when they celebrate Passover before he is sacrificed.

SO, God’s plan to rescue us has always been in the works. Even today, because he loves us He wants to help us!


Check out more cool stuff at http://crossroadskidsclub.net/

videos.title: Mysteries of the Bible: Promises
videos.description:
What’s a covenant? How long does it last? Why does it matter today?

So, a covenant is just another way of talking about “God’s promises and our commitments”. When God makes a promise he keeps it and it lasts forever, that is, until he fulfills it. 
God made five covenants in the bible. Here are three to get you thinking.

God promised many things to Abraham. He personally promised that He would make Abraham’s family in to a great nation and somehow, God would bring his blessing to all humanity through Abraham’s family, the Israelites. 

The covenant with Moses gave us a set of laws or commandments to live by. Following them meant we would receive God’s blessing, and disobeying meant God’s anger. But, in the end God wouldn’t stay angry forever because of the new covenant.

The New Covenant is a promise made with everyone. In the New Covenant, Jesus promises to fulfill all the past covenants and by doing so, forgive all sin. He also asks God to send us a helper, the Holy Spirit, to guide us back to God.

SO, in the end God’s promises are bigger than our failures and His promises are everlasting, even today.

Think about that next time you open your bible. 

Check out more cool stuff at http://crossroadskidsclub.net/

videos.title: God's Story: Jesus was like us
videos.description:
Welcome to the Crossroads’ Kids’ Club channel! We have all kinds of cool stuff here for you to explore, and we’re always updating with brand new content. Subscribe and stick around so you never miss out on new and exciting videos that the whole family can enjoy! Be sure to like and comment as well. We’d love to hear from you. Thanks for checking out the channel!

Even though Jesus is God he’s also like us too. You might have already heard some stories about Jesus. Some stories are really famous. Like how Jesus was born at Christmas ...or how he died on a cross and then came back to life on Easter. You also might have heard that Jesus taught big crowds or made sick people feel better and healed them. He did do all those things, but that’s not all there is to know about Jesus. He also did a lot of normal stuff, like help his mom with chores, play with his brothers and sisters, maybe even snored. The Bible never actually says Jesus snored, but it does say he was like us.

videos.title: Kids' Club Anywhere | Christmas
videos.description:
In this episode of Kids' Club Anywhere, we use beatboxing, mad libs and gift-giving dinosaurs to share the story of Christmas and remind us that Jesus was the best surprise EVER! 

Kids' Club Anywhere is a Christmas video experience that the whole family can enjoy together. After you watch, here are some questions for your family to discuss together.

CONVO STARTER 1:
Generous Rex surprised people with unexpected gifts! What’s the best surprise you’ve ever received? What’s the best surprise you’ve ever given to someone else? 

CONVO STARTER 2:
Jesus’ birth happened in a totally unexpected way. What are the most surprising parts of the Christmas story? How are they different (or the same) to how YOU were born? 

CONVO STARTER 3:
You’ve heard the Christmas story through beatboxing...now read it in the Bible! Read Luke 2:1-20: How did people worship the long-awaited rescuer, Jesus? As a family, how can you worship Jesus this Christmas? 

Welcome to the Crossroads’ Kids’ Club channel! We have all kinds of cool stuff here for you to explore, and we’re always updating with brand new content. videos.title: God's Story: The Bible
videos.description:
The Bible is no ordinary book. It's all about God, and how much he loves us. Now, you might think the Bible is a big long list of rules and names, but it’s not! You might also think it’s about a bunch of perfect people who always followed God’s rules.

Actually, the Bible is a bunch of stories, poems, letters, and even songs -- that are all telling ONE BIG STORY -- that have been put together into one big book. And everything in the Bible is true! Like how God created the whole world and everything in it. And the stories about Jesus, God’s son. And in between, there are LOTS of stories written by all kinds of people. But the amazing thing about the Bible is, all these stories came from God! 

The first part of the Bible is called the Old Testament. It tells the story of God’s special family, the Israelites, and how God promised that through them he would bless the whole world. To help them do that, God gave them “The Torah,” or The Law. These were ways for the Israelites to live differently than other nations -- by welcoming people who were different from them, forgiving each other, and following God. 

The only problem was, no one was able to follow ALL the rules. This is what the middle part of the Bible is about. People tried as hard as they could, but they kept making mistakes. And every time, God forgave them and promised them that someone would come, a King, a Rescuer, who would actually follow all of God's rules and show us what God is like.

Well, Israel waited a LONG time for the King who was also the Rescuer. While they were waiting, Israel had good kings and not-so-good kings. Sometimes the people in charge forgot about God and started to worship other gods. And sometimes they even got taken over by other countries. 

And whenever God would do something amazing -- like when he saved three guys from a fiery furnace, or when he sent messages to prophets like Jeremiah or Ezekiel -- or even when ordinary people like Ruth decided to be part of God’s family -- people would write it down. They wanted to remember what God had done, and teach their kids what God was like: he’s powerful, he’s loving, and he’s GOOD.

In some stories, God reminds us he’s a good king -- powerful and mighty, someone who saves his people from danger. In other stories, God reminds us he’s a good father taking care of his children. Or like a good shepherd, gently taking care of his sheep. 
Now that’s all in the Old Testament. The next part, the New Testament, starts with four books full of stories about Jesus!

Jesus was God’s Son, and he lived a perfect life without breaking any of God’s rules. He taught people about God, and showed people how to be like him, by helping those who were poor and sick. Then, Jesus died for our wrong choices and came back to life -- which was a pretty amazing thing!

It was so amazing, that people made sure they wrote down the stories about Jesus. And as more and more people started following Jesus, there were more amazing stories to write down! Like when the Holy Spirit came down like wind on Pentecost. Or when people who followed Jesus performed miracles.Or even when one of Jesus’s friends, John, had a crazy dream about what it will be like when Jesus comes back to rule the entire world.

After Jesus came back to life and then went to heaven -- yeah, that happened! -- people who followed Jesus wanted to put together all these stories about the Law, the Israelites, Jesus, and the early church -- into one big book. It took a few tries before everyone agreed on what parts should be in what order. But that’s how we have this big book called the Bible.

Today, people still read the Bible all over the world, because what was true a long time ago, is still true today! God always stays the same. God still speaks to us, he forgives us and loves us, and he’s always GOOD. And when we read the Bible, we can still learn about who God is, and what he’s like.

The Bible says, “All Scripture is inspired by God and is useful to teach us what is true and to make us realize what is wrong in our lives. It corrects us when we are wrong and teaches us to do what is right.” (2 Tim 3:16 NLT)

And THAT’s the story of the Bible.

So in case you missed it, here’s the quick version: The Bible is a book of stories about God. The Old Testament is about Israel. The New Testament is about Jesus and his followers. We can still learn about God today.

And THAT’s a part of God’s Story.

videos.title: LET'S GO : The Wilderness
videos.description:
So in the Bible, there are all these stories about people in the WILDERNESS. They’re usually there for a reason, like either God’s going to prove something to them, or He wants THEM to prove something to HIM. 

I know, super epic. Let’s GO find some WILDERNESS.

This is Wilderness. It’s actually a region in Israel that used to be called Moab… Today, you can find it on a map just west of the Dead Sea. I mean, LOOK at this place. It’s dry, it’s dusty, it’s hot. There isn’t any shade because not much grows here. It’s uncomfortable. You get sweaty and thirsty just being out here for ten minutes. When the Bible talks about Wilderness, it’s a dangerous desert. There are rocks and cliffs and nasty dangerous animals -- like the deathstalker scorpion and one of the most poisonous snakes in the world, the black adder. It’s where God would send people to be TESTED. When God rescued the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt, he had Moses take them through the Red Sea and into the Wilderness. 

God was TESTING Israel to see if they would TRUST him. Fast-forward a LOOOONG time. The Wilderness is still there when Jesus steps onto the scene. Matthew chapter 4 says, “Jesus was led by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil. After fasting forty days and forty nights, he was hungry. The devil came to him and said, “If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread.” 

Now think about this for a minute. Jesus is in the Wilderness where Moses and the Israelites had been tested -- and he’s thirsty and hungry, just like they were thirsty and hungry! The Israelites had to learn to trust that God would give them food and water. How did Jesus handle this temptation? Does he do some magic trick to turn stones into bread? No! He says, “It is written: ‘Man shall not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.’” Jesus KNEW his Bible! He knew that the whole point of the story was whether people would choose to trust God, or not. Jesus trusted God even when he was hungry -- because he knew it wasn’t food that kept him alive, it was God!

The devil knew the Bible, too, though. “Then the devil took him to the holy city and had him stand on the highest point of the temple. “If you are the Son of God,” he said, “throw yourself down.” Then the devil quoted the Bible! He said, “For it is written: ‘He will command his angels concerning you, and they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.’” That’s an exact quote from Psalm 91! But Jesus quoted the Bible right back. “It is also written: ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.”

The devil tempted Jesus a THIRD time, this time on a high mountain like this. Jesus could see cities, whole kingdoms, from up here. The devil said, “All this I will give you, if you will bow down and worship me.” But Jesus shut down temptation a third time! “Away from me, Satan! For it is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.’”

WHOO! Jesus passed the test three times. Every time, Jesus remembered things God had said: that we should worship him alone. That God is the one who tests us, not the other way around. And that we should TRUST him.

Now, you don’t have to go to the actual Wilderness to be tested. You might be tested the next time you have to wait for something and need to be patient. You might be going through something that FEELS like a wilderness -- you might feel alone or scared or even mad at God. Or you might even feel tempted to do something you know you’re not supposed to do. 

So what do you think? What’s like “the Wilderness” in YOUR life? Are there times you feel tempted not to trust God, or not to obey him? When do you feel worried that God won’t take care of you? 

Whatever is going on, GOD IS WITH YOU. And that’s true wherever you are.

videos.title: Kids' Club Easter Experience
videos.description:
Happy Easter! Today you’re going to hear about the most incredible story EVER!!! It’s the story of Easter. It’s about a man named Jesus who changed the world forever. Jesus was a real guy who really lived in a real place called Israel. 

He was a great teacher and he did miracles and healed people, but most importantly, he was God’s son. Born as a baby, but actually a king! He showed people how to be a part of the Kingdom of God. And that got him in some trouble with the powerful religious leaders, who wanted people to keep following them and doing things like they had always been done. They were so scared of the change Jesus was bringing that they actually decided to kill Jesus. And they did. But...Jesus came back to life. 

In fact, that’s the big idea for Easter: Jesus died and came back to life...for US! Earlier this year, Kids' Club went to Israel to see some of the places where Jesus actually lived and where he spent his time. And we wanted YOU to be able to see it too! 

If you want to check out more stuff about Easter or you have more questions about what it means to follow Jesus, go to crossroadskidsclub.net/easter. You can also connect with other families at our Facebook page: facebook.com/crdschurchkc.

videos.title: God's Story: After the Tomb
videos.description:
So part of God’s story is about what happened in the forty days after Jesus came back to life, and it goes like this.

Remember when Jesus came to earth, healed people, taught people about the Kingdom of God and then died for the punishment we deserve? And then how he came back to life?! It’s all true. That really happened. But it took some time for Jesus’ followers to hear this Good News.

Like two men who were walking together to a place called Emmaus. It was the same day that Jesus’ tomb had been found empty, but they didn’t know this. All they knew was Jesus had just died. And they were sad and confused because they had thought he would save their people and change everything. And they were scared because they had no idea what to expect now that he was gone. 

They had heard that some women went to Jesus’ tomb, but he wasn’t in it. Instead there were angels, and they told them, “He’s not here. He is risen!”! But these were all still just stories to the two men. 

As they walked and talked, another man appeared and began walking beside them. It was Jesus, but they didn’t recognize him. The man asked them what they were talking about. They couldn’t believe this stranger didn’t know what had just happened in Jerusalem. It was the biggest news in the land. So they told this man about Jesus. How he had been a great teacher and prophet, how he had healed people, but then was arrested and killed. 

They walked and talked with Jesus for the rest of the day, still not recognizing that they were talking to Jesus. In fact, it wasn’t until dinner that they realized it was him. And as soon as they did, Jesus was gone. Just...disappeared. 

The two men didn’t waste any time getting back to Jerusalem to tell their friends what had happened. They found them hiding together, with all the doors locked and the windows shut tight. See, after Jesus was killed, it was dangerous to be known as his disciple. So they were scared. 

But the two men told them that the rumors were true. Jesus had risen and they had seen him, talked to him and eaten with him! And as they were telling this story, Jesus appeared to the disciples again. Even though the doors and windows were locked. Maybe they thought they were seeing a ghost. Maybe some of them weren’t even sure it was him. But Jesus knew their doubts and told them, “See my hands. Reach out your hand and put it into my side. Stop doubting and believe.” 

This was the same Jesus they knew. The same Jesus they had watched teach crowds and heal people. He was real. Not a ghost. Not a dream. It was Jesus and he was right there with them.

But this wasn’t the last time Jesus would appear to his friends. Later, Peter and some of the other disciples went to the Sea of Galilee. They stayed up all night long fishing, but didn’t catch a single thing. In the morning, a man called to them from the shore. “Do you have any fish??”. 

Now this was Jesus, but just like before, the disciples didn’t recognize him. When they told this stranger that, no, in fact they hadn’t caught any fish at all, he told them, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.” They did as he said and immediately, the net was completely full of fish.

Right then, one of the disciples in the boat, John, knew that he was seeing Jesus. He Peter jumped in the water and got to shore as fast as he could. When he got there, there was a fire with bread and fish on the hot coals. There, the disciples and Jesus ate breakfast together, just like they had before. And they all knew without a doubt that this was Jesus.

After this, Jesus appeared to over 500 people. And later, the Bible says Jesus was taken up into heaven. But just because Jesus wasn’t on earth with his friends didn’t mean they were alone. Jesus had told them he would leave, but he also said he would send the Holy Spirit to be with them. And that one day, he WILL come back and make everything new.

And THAT’s the story of what happened after the tomb.

So in case you missed it, here’s the quick version: Jesus died. He came back to life. He spent time with his friends. He was taken up into heaven. He sent His Holy Spirit. And he’ll be back again. 

And THAT is a part of God’s story.

videos.title: One Lost Sheep | God's Story
videos.description:
There's all kinds of cool stuff on the Kids' Club channel for you to explore and we’re always updating with brand new content. Subscribe and stick around so you never miss out on new and exciting videos that the whole family can enjoy. And be sure to like and comment as well! We’d love to hear from you.

So part of God’s Story is about a shepherd and a lost sheep, and it goes like this.

Jesus spent a lot of time teaching people about God’s love. And sometimes, people wanted to spend time with Jesus after he got finished teaching -- so they would invite him over for dinner. Jesus loved to spend time with people. Jesus would even hang out with people who no one else wanted to hang out with.

This bothered some other people called Pharisees. Pharisees were religious experts who thought it was WRONG for Jesus to spend time with certain kinds of people. One day, the Pharisees muttered, “Jesus welcomes sinners -- and eats with them!” 

But Jesus knew God still loves people, even when we make wrong choices. So Jesus told the Pharisees a story to teach them a lesson about God. These stories were called “parables.” 

This is the Parable of the One Lost Sheep. Jesus said:

Suppose you were a shepherd with one hundred sheep.
And one of your sheep got lost. Wouldn’t you leave the ninety-nine, in open country, and go after the sheep until you found it? And when you found it, you would joyfully put the sheep on your shoulders and take it home. And when you got home, you would call your friends and neighbors together and say, “Rejoice with me! I have found my lost sheep!”

The people listening were probably thinking about the shepherds they knew. Good shepherds paid attention to their sheep, they knew each one by name, and they kept them safe from danger. They would have remembered the poems by the prophet Ezekiel and King David where God said he was like a shepherd. Of course a good shepherd would want ALL of his sheep to be safe, and would do whatever it took to rescue his one lost sheep -- even risking his own life!

Then Jesus explained the parable to the Pharisees. “In the same way, there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who do not need to repent.”

See, the ninety-nine sheep are like people who already believe in Jesus. The lost sheep are like the people who don’t know how much God loves them, or that Jesus came to rescue them. And Jesus is the good shepherd, who was willing to lay down his own life to rescue his lost sheep. 

Jesus said that he “came to seek and save those who are lost”.

When a person starts to follow Jesus, Jesus said it’s like a party in heaven! We don’t really know exactly what a party in heaven looks like. But since God made everything, and God is the reason good things like love and fun and laughter exist, a party in heaven is probably bigger and better than anything we could imagine. And Jesus wants everyone to know that it’s a party where EVERYONE is invited.

Because EVERY single person matters to God. 

And THAT’s the story of the shepherd and one lost sheep.

In case you missed it, here’s the quick version.

Jesus told stories called parables. One parable is about a shepherd and one hundred sheep. One sheep got lost. The shepherd left the ninety-nine. The lost sheep was found! The shepherd threw a party. Because God cares about every single person.

And THAT’s a part of God’s Story.

Sources: Matt 18:1-14, Luke 15:1-7, Ezekiel 34:11-16

What do you think it's like being a part of God's Kingdom?

videos.title: God's Story: Unforgiving Servant
videos.description:
Jesus told the disciples that God is like a king who forgave his servant’s debt. God forgives US too….no matter how many times we sin. And because God forgives us, God expects us to forgive others! Check out the full story here.

videos.title: I Hear Bells! | Advent | Kids' Club Older
videos.description:
The Bible talks a lot about Jesus before he was even born. God told a prophet named Isaiah that Jesus was coming to rescue the world, and Jesus did! After you’ve watched the video, use these convo starters to talk about it. Plus, find coloring pages and activity sheets here: link.crossroads.net/evf2hsvo

Convo Starters: 
How did Isiah know that Jesus would come in the future?
What kinds of things were said about Jesus before he was born?
How can we show Jesus we are thankful that he rescued us?

A special thanks to The Five Mile Chapel Society in Anderson Township, Ohio for allowing Kids' Club to capture your historic and beautiful chapel and bell tower!

videos.title: Storytellers: Jesus Defends a Woman
videos.description:
Jesus taught people that part of loving God is loving others, even when they make mistakes. When a woman was being judged by a crowd of people, Jesus reminded them that they were all sinners, just like her. They listened to Jesus and didn’t judge her anymore, and we shouldn’t judge people either. Check out this video to learn more about how Jesus forgives us!

videos.title: We Can Be Peacemakers! | Abigail | Kids' Club Older
videos.description:
When we follow Jesus, we can grow the fruit of peace in our lives and share it with others, just like planting seeds in good soil! Join us to learn more about Abigail and how we can be peacemakers just like her! After you’ve watched the video use these convo starters to talk about it.
